00041 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_SEC
00042 
00043 #include <linux/kthread.h>
00044 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00045 
00046 #include <obd_support.h>
00047 #include <obd_class.h>
00048 #include <lustre_net.h>
00049 #include <lustre_sec.h>
00050 
00051 #include "ptlrpc_internal.h"
00052 
00053 #define SEC_GC_INTERVAL (30 * 60)
00054 
00055 
00056 static struct mutex sec_gc_mutex;
00057 static spinlock_t sec_gc_list_lock;
00058 static struct list_head sec_gc_list;
00059 
00060 static spinlock_t sec_gc_ctx_list_lock;
00061 static struct list_head sec_gc_ctx_list;
00062 
00063 static struct ptlrpc_thread sec_gc_thread;
00064 static atomic_t sec_gc_wait_del = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
00065 
00066 
00067 void sptlrpc_gc_add_sec(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00068 {
00069         LASSERT(sec->ps_policy->sp_cops->gc_ctx);
00070         LASSERT(sec->ps_gc_interval > 0);
00071         LASSERT(list_empty(&sec->ps_gc_list));
00072 
00073         sec->ps_gc_next = cfs_time_current_sec() + sec->ps_gc_interval;
00074 
00075         spin_lock(&sec_gc_list_lock);
00076         list_add_tail(&sec_gc_list, &sec->ps_gc_list);
00077         spin_unlock(&sec_gc_list_lock);
00078 
00079         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "added sec %p(%s)\n", sec, sec->ps_policy->sp_name);
00080 }
00081 
00082 void sptlrpc_gc_del_sec(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00083 {
00084         if (list_empty(&sec->ps_gc_list))
00085                 return;
00086 
00087         might_sleep();
00088 
00089         /* signal before list_del to make iteration in gc thread safe */
00090         atomic_inc(&sec_gc_wait_del);
00091 
00092         spin_lock(&sec_gc_list_lock);
00093         list_del_init(&sec->ps_gc_list);
00094         spin_unlock(&sec_gc_list_lock);
00095 
00096         /* barrier */
00097         mutex_lock(&sec_gc_mutex);
00098         mutex_unlock(&sec_gc_mutex);
00099 
00100         atomic_dec(&sec_gc_wait_del);
00101 
00102         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "del sec %p(%s)\n", sec, sec->ps_policy->sp_name);
00103 }
00104 
00105 void sptlrpc_gc_add_ctx(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00106 {
00107         LASSERT(list_empty(&ctx->cc_gc_chain));
00108 
00109         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "hand over ctx %p(%u->%s)\n",
00110                ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec));
00111         spin_lock(&sec_gc_ctx_list_lock);
00112         list_add(&ctx->cc_gc_chain, &sec_gc_ctx_list);
00113         spin_unlock(&sec_gc_ctx_list_lock);
00114 
00115         thread_add_flags(&sec_gc_thread, SVC_SIGNAL);
00116         wake_up(&sec_gc_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00117 }
00118 EXPORT_SYMBOL(sptlrpc_gc_add_ctx);
00119 
00120 static void sec_process_ctx_list(void)
00121 {
00122         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx;
00123 
00124         spin_lock(&sec_gc_ctx_list_lock);
00125 
00126         while (!list_empty(&sec_gc_ctx_list)) {
00127                 ctx = list_entry(sec_gc_ctx_list.next,
00128                                      struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx, cc_gc_chain);
00129                 list_del_init(&ctx->cc_gc_chain);
00130                 spin_unlock(&sec_gc_ctx_list_lock);
00131 
00132                 LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec);
00133                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) == 1);
00134                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "gc pick up ctx %p(%u->%s)\n",
00135                        ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec));
00136                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_put(ctx, 1);
00137 
00138                 spin_lock(&sec_gc_ctx_list_lock);
00139         }
00140 
00141         spin_unlock(&sec_gc_ctx_list_lock);
00142 }
00143 
00144 static void sec_do_gc(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00145 {
00146         LASSERT(sec->ps_policy->sp_cops->gc_ctx);
00147 
00148         if (unlikely(sec->ps_gc_next == 0)) {
00149                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "sec %p(%s) has 0 gc time\n",
00150                       sec, sec->ps_policy->sp_name);
00151                 return;
00152         }
00153 
00154         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "check on sec %p(%s)\n", sec, sec->ps_policy->sp_name);
00155 
00156         if (cfs_time_after(sec->ps_gc_next, cfs_time_current_sec()))
00157                 return;
00158 
00159         sec->ps_policy->sp_cops->gc_ctx(sec);
00160         sec->ps_gc_next = cfs_time_current_sec() + sec->ps_gc_interval;
00161 }
00162 
00163 static int sec_gc_main(void *arg)
00164 {
00165         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = (struct ptlrpc_thread *) arg;
00166         struct l_wait_info    lwi;
00167 
00168         unshare_fs_struct();
00169 
00170         /* Record that the thread is running */
00171         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_RUNNING);
00172         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00173 
00174         while (1) {
00175                 struct ptlrpc_sec *sec;
00176 
00177                 thread_clear_flags(thread, SVC_SIGNAL);
00178                 sec_process_ctx_list();
00179 again:
00180                 /* go through sec list do gc.
00181                  * FIXME here we iterate through the whole list each time which
00182                  * is not optimal. we perhaps want to use balanced binary tree
00183                  * to trace each sec as order of expiry time.
00184                  * another issue here is we wakeup as fixed interval instead of
00185                  * according to each sec's expiry time */
00186                 mutex_lock(&sec_gc_mutex);
00187                 list_for_each_entry(sec, &sec_gc_list, ps_gc_list) {
00188                         /* if someone is waiting to be deleted, let it
00189                          * proceed as soon as possible. */
00190                         if (atomic_read(&sec_gc_wait_del)) {
00191                                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "deletion pending, start over\n");
00192                                 mutex_unlock(&sec_gc_mutex);
00193                                 goto again;
00194                         }
00195 
00196                         sec_do_gc(sec);
00197                 }
00198                 mutex_unlock(&sec_gc_mutex);
00199 
00200                 /* check ctx list again before sleep */
00201                 sec_process_ctx_list();
00202 
00203                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(msecs_to_jiffies(SEC_GC_INTERVAL *
00204                                                    MSEC_PER_SEC),
00205                                   NULL, NULL);
00206                 l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
00207                              thread_is_stopping(thread) ||
00208                              thread_is_signal(thread),
00209                              &lwi);
00210 
00211                 if (thread_test_and_clear_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPING))
00212                         break;
00213         }
00214 
00215         thread_set_flags(thread, SVC_STOPPED);
00216         wake_up(&thread->t_ctl_waitq);
00217         return 0;
00218 }
00219 
00220 int sptlrpc_gc_init(void)
00221 {
00222         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00223         struct task_struct *task;
00224 
00225         mutex_init(&sec_gc_mutex);
00226         spin_lock_init(&sec_gc_list_lock);
00227         spin_lock_init(&sec_gc_ctx_list_lock);
00228 
00229         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sec_gc_list);
00230         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sec_gc_ctx_list);
00231 
00232         /* initialize thread control */
00233         memset(&sec_gc_thread, 0, sizeof(sec_gc_thread));
00234         init_waitqueue_head(&sec_gc_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00235 
00236         task = kthread_run(sec_gc_main, &sec_gc_thread, "sptlrpc_gc");
00237         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00238                 CERROR("can't start gc thread: %ld\n", PTR_ERR(task));
00239                 return PTR_ERR(task);
00240         }
00241 
00242         l_wait_event(sec_gc_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
00243                      thread_is_running(&sec_gc_thread), &lwi);
00244         return 0;
00245 }
00246 
00247 void sptlrpc_gc_fini(void)
00248 {
00249         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00250 
00251         thread_set_flags(&sec_gc_thread, SVC_STOPPING);
00252         wake_up(&sec_gc_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00253 
00254         l_wait_event(sec_gc_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
00255                      thread_is_stopped(&sec_gc_thread), &lwi);
00256 }
